2.text: “As surely as God lives, who has deprived me of justice—the Almighty, who has embittered my soul—

3.text: as long as my breath is still within me and the breath of God remains in my nostrils,

4.text: my lips will not speak wickedness, and my tongue will not utter deceit.

5.text: I will never say that you are right; I will maintain my integrity until I die.

6.text: I will cling to my righteousness and never let go. As long as I live, my conscience will not accuse me.

7.text: May my enemy be like the wicked and my opponent like the unjust.

8.text: For what is the hope of the godless when he is cut off, when God takes away his life?

9.text: Will God hear his cry when distress comes upon him?

10.text: Will he delight in the Almighty? Will he call upon God at all times?

11.text: I will instruct you in the power of God. I will not conceal the ways of the Almighty.

12.text: Surely all of you have seen it for yourselves. Why then do you keep up this empty talk?

13.text: This is the wicked man’s portion from God—the heritage the ruthless receive from the Almighty.

14.text: Though his sons are many, they are destined for the sword; and his offspring will never have enough food.

15.text: His survivors will be buried by the plague, and their widows will not weep for them.

16.text: Though he heaps up silver like dust and piles up a wardrobe like clay,

17.text: what he lays up, the righteous will wear, and his silver will be divided by the innocent.

18.text: The house he built is like a moth’s cocoon, like a hut set up by a watchman.

19.text: He lies down wealthy, but will do so no more; when he opens his eyes, all is gone.

20.text: Terrors overtake him like a flood; a tempest sweeps him away in the night.

21.text: The east wind carries him away, and he is gone; it sweeps him out of his place.

22.text: It hurls itself against him without mercy as he flees headlong from its power.

23.text: It claps its hands at him and hisses him out of his place.
